meanings.definition: The amount that a room can hold.
meanings.sent1: The classroom was so full, it had roomfuls of students.
meanings.sent2: The storage unit could fit roomfuls of boxes.
meanings.sent3: The party was so crowded that it had roomfuls of people spilling out the door.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was filled with roomfuls of love for her family.
meanings.sent5: The library shelves were stacked with roomfuls of books waiting to be read.

meanings.definition: A large quantity of rooms filled with something.
meanings.sent1: The hotel had roomfuls of guests during the busy season.
meanings.sent2: The mansion had roomfuls of luxurious bedrooms.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house had roomfuls of spooky surprises around every corner.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a mansion with roomfuls of memories to explore.
meanings.sent5: The storage facility had roomfuls of treasures waiting to be discovered.
